school_story_8.2_screen_10_title: Whatever currency you have, if you travel to a country where they use a different one, you have to exchange money to the currency they use there.
school_story_8.2_screen_10_button_2_titl: I know, I have traveled a lot
school_story_8.2_screen_11_title: I brought piggybucks to the four different countries I visited in Europe.
school_story_8.2_screen_11_subtitle: I had to exchange my own currency to the currency of those countries.
school_story_8.2_screen_11_button_1_titl: Of course, you can't shop with pb!
school_story_8.2_screen_11_button_3_titl: Still don't know how it works
school_story_8.2_screen_11_button_4_titl: Did you spend a lot of money?
school_story_8.2_screen_12_title: So, I have a riddle for you. I visited four countries in Europe.
school_story_8.2_screen_12_subtitle: But I only had to exchange the currency twice. Do you know why?
school_story_8.2_screen_12_button_3_titl: Some of them don't have currency
school_story_8.2_screen_12_button_4_titl: Because some countries in Europe have the same currency
school_story_8.2_screen_13_title: The correct answer is that some countries in Europe use the same currency: Euro.
school_story_8.2_screen_13_subtitle: So when I had exchanged money I could use it in more than one of the countries I visited.
school_story_8.2_screen_13_button_4_titl: I have used euro a lot
school_story_8.2_screen_14_title: That's how it is, because they use their own currency in different countries, to be able to buy anything you need to have the same currency.
school_story_8.2_screen_14_subtitle: And to get it, you exchange your currency for their currency. How much you get, depends on the exchange rate. Now it's challenge time!
school_story_8.3_screen_1_title: How do currencies work when you travel abroad?
school_story_8.3_screen_2_title: If you travel to a country where they don't use cards that much, you have to bring your own currency with you.
school_story_8.3_screen_2_subtitle: You can usually exchange your money in special currency exchange shops in those countries.
school_story_8.3_screen_3_title: You can also exchange the money at home before you go. All countries have places to exchange money. Even yours!
school_story_8.3_screen_3_subtitle: In most countries you can exchange money in the banks or in currency exchange shops.
school_story_8.3_screen_4_title: It's very easy to pay in countries where they accept payments by card in most places.
school_story_8.3_screen_4_subtitle: But you should still calculate what the product costs in your own currency, otherwise you might buy something that is unnecessarily expensive.
school_story_8.3_screen_5_title: You can use most bank cards all over the world where they accept card payments.
school_story_8.3_screen_5_subtitle: So you pay directly with your card in the shop and your bank makes the currency exchange digitally.
school_story_8.3_screen_6_title: But sometimes you still need cash! Then you can withdraw money from an ATM wherever you're at.
school_story_8.3_screen_6_subtitle: Again, the same thing happens if you withdraw from the ATM: The bank makes the exchange digitally.
school_story_8.3_screen_9_title: To understand that there is always an exchange taking place. No matter how you do it: digitally or with cash.
school_story_8.3_screen_9_subtitle: You exchange one currency for another. And that's also true when you shop abroad in the store using a card.
school_story_8.3_screen_10_subtitle: Different currencies are not worth the same.
school_story_8.3_screen_11_button_1_titl: Yes, but I can't explain it
school_story_8.3_screen_11_button_4_titl: Pants were worth more than bread?
school_story_8.3_screen_12_title: You would give away several loaves of bread because a pair of pants are worth more than a loaf of bread.
school_story_8.3_screen_12_subtitle: With currency it works the same way really.
school_story_8.3_screen_13_title: If the currency you want to exchang to is worth more than yours, you have to give more of your currency but get less of the other in the exchange. The value of the money is still similar, but not the amount of currency.
school_story_8.3_screen_13_subtitle: When you compare two currencies, the exchange rate is usually written as a number. 5 for example. The exchange rate then tells you you need to give 5 of your own currency to get 1 of the other one.
school_story_8.3_screen_14_title: Let's pretend you want to exchange piggybucks to euros and that the exchange rate for that is 5.
school_story_8.3_screen_14_subtitle: In this example, a euro is worth more than a piggybuck, because you have to give 5 piggybucks for every 1 euro you want to exchange.
school_story_8.3_screen_15_title: The exchange rate is decided globally. That means that all countries in the world agree to calculate it like this. And all currencies have a currency code; swedish kronor are called SEK and euro EUR.
school_story_8.3_screen_15_subtitle: You can see the currency rate as the currency's price, but the currency rate is always in relation to another currency.
school_story_9.1_screen_1_title: Alright! Now we're going to shop until we drop! Oh no, sorry! I forgot I have to stay with my cat Fido. She hates crowds...
school_story_9.1_screen_1_subtitle: ...and strangely enough the smell of money being spent! Crazy cat.
school_story_9.1_screen_1_button_4_title: It might be able to help you save!
school_story_9.1_screen_2_title: But, let's talk! And we'll talk about spending and different ways to pay.
school_story_9.1_screen_2_subtitle: Yeah, I think Iâ€™ll start as I usually do; with a question! What is spending?
school_story_9.1_screen_3_title: It can be difficult to define when you do not specify what you are talking about. You can spend a lot of things, not just money.
school_story_9.1_screen_3_subtitle: You can spend time, for example, and you can spend the summer resting your brain. And of course you can spend money.
school_story_9.1_screen_3_button_1_title: Yes! Great way to spend the summer!
school_story_9.1_screen_3_button_2_title: I like to use my brain
school_story_9.1_screen_4_title: And the word spend means: â€using something with the understanding that you will have less afterwardsâ€. This is the case with money!
school_story_9.1_screen_4_subtitle: If you only have expenses, you will eventually run out of money. That's exactly why you earn and save: to be able to spend money without running out!
school_story_9.1_screen_4_button_1_title: Yes! Now I see the connection!
school_story_9.1_screen_4_button_3_title: Iâ€™ve known that for a long time!
school_story_9.1_screen_4_button_4_title: Ah, Iâ€™ll have to think about this
school_story_9.1_screen_5_title: If you spend smart, the money will last longer and for more things!
school_story_9.1_screen_6_title: When you spend money you pay for things. . you buy products or services you want, or pay bills that are necessary.
school_story_9.1_screen_6_subtitle: That's why I think you need to know about different ways to pay and how they work.
school_story_9.1_screen_8_title: Today, a lot of our money is digital, and that means we have many new ways of paying for things.
school_story_9.1_screen_8_subtitle: I mean thereâ€™s newer way of paying than cash or with a card.
school_story_9.1_screen_9_title: Iâ€™ll tell you about some of them. You can pay with apps or your phone in different ways, like with Apple Wallet.
school_story_9.1_screen_9_subtitle: And you can even pay with a smartwatch!
school_story_9.1_screen_10_title: Have you thought about how that really works? Where does the money come from, when you tap your phone to pay?
school_story_9.1_screen_10_button_2_titl: Didnâ€™t even know that was possible
school_story_9.1_screen_11_title: Well, all these new ways of paying are actually based on the â€œclassicâ€ ways of paying.
school_story_9.1_screen_11_subtitle: And Iâ€™ll explain more about how that works later, but let me first go through the â€œclassicâ€ ways, as I call them.
school_story_9.1_screen_12_title: When I talk about the classic ways of paying, I mean paying with cash or some type of card.
school_story_9.1_screen_12_subtitle: You already know how to pay with cash. But do you know what actually happens when you pay with a card?
school_story_9.1_screen_13_title: The answer is actually a bit different depending on what type of card you are using. See! It's already more complicated that you'd think!
school_story_9.1_screen_13_subtitle: I'll explain the most common cards and how they work in the next destination.
school_story_9.1_screen_13_button_1_titl: Alright, Iâ€™ll do the challenge now
school_story_9.2_screen_1_title: I hope youâ€™re ready, because now we'll talk about the three most common types of cards.
school_story_9.2_screen_2_title: Let's talk about the bank card first. It is the most used card in most countries in the world.
school_story_9.2_screen_2_subtitle: Itâ€™s also the card that you may already be using, or will get soon. unlike credit cards, you can get a bank card when you are younger than 18 years old.
school_story_9.2_screen_2_button_1_title: Oh no, the credit card seemed cool
school_story_9.2_screen_2_button_4_title: I have some type of card
school_story_9.2_screen_3_title: A bank card, as you can tell from the name, is a card youâ€™re given by your bank.
school_story_9.2_screen_3_subtitle: To get a bank card you must have a special account with that bank. The card is connected to that account..
school_story_9.2_screen_4_title: Since the bank card is connected to the account, the money is withdrawn from that account when you use it the store or online.
school_story_9.2_screen_4_subtitle: But of course, someone needs to put the money into the account first, otherwise the balance will be 0!
school_story_9.2_screen_5_title: When you use the card in a card reader in a store, the reader checks the balance on your bank account first..
school_story_9.2_screen_5_subtitle: If thereâ€™s enough money the purchase is accepted and the money is removed from the account.
school_story_9.2_screen_6_title: If there isnâ€™t enough money on the account the card reader will give the message â€œerrorâ€â€¦
school_story_9.2_screen_6_subtitle: Itâ€™ll say that the transaction is denied. You wonâ€™t be able to buy the thing you wanted to get.
school_story_9.2_screen_7_title: What do you think seems smart to do to avoid getting an error message and not being able to get the thing you wanted to buy?
school_story_9.2_screen_9_title: The best answer is to keep track of the balance. A tip is to go into your bank app or your digital piggy bank often to check it.
school_story_9.2_screen_9_subtitle: If you shop a lot, then maybe at least every evening. In that way you can easily understand where your money is going and how much you have left to spend.
school_story_9.2_screen_10_title: Iâ€™ve said it many times before: you should know your balance. Knowing that is in many ways important, also to keep track of the money you earn and the money you spend.
school_story_9.2_screen_10_subtitle: That way youâ€™ll avoid spending more than you have, and have more control over your finances.
school_story_9.2_screen_10_button_1_titl: And you will probably say it again
school_story_9.2_screen_11_title: Yeah! I will keep talking about that, haha.
school_story_9.2_screen_11_subtitle: Alright, so youâ€™ve learned how the bank card works. Letâ€™s talk about the prepaid card now. It works almost the same way as the bank card.
school_story_9.2_screen_11_button_1_titl: I may have heard of it
school_story_9.2_screen_12_title: The prepaid cardworks the same way when you pay, but thereâ€™s no account connected to the card.
school_story_9.2_screen_12_subtitle: All the money must be added to the card before you shop. You charge it, like a gift card.
school_story_9.2_screen_13_title: The big difference is that a gift card can only be used in the store where you bought it, while the prepaid card works almost everywhere.
school_story_9.2_screen_14_title: The two cards weâ€™ve just talked about, the prepaid card and the bank card, are very similar. You must have money before you buy something.
school_story_9.2_screen_14_subtitle: The only difference is that with the prepaid card, the money is on the card. With the bank card, the money is in a bank account.
school_story_9.3_screen_1_title: I hope it went well and that you got to rehearse what you learned!
school_story_9.3_screen_1_subtitle: The last thing we talked about before the challenge was the prepaid card.
school_story_9.3_screen_1_button_1_title: That seems to be the case!
school_story_9.3_screen_2_title: So that leaves the last card that I mentioned: The credit card.
school_story_9.3_screen_2_subtitle: Do you know what it is?
school_story_9.3_screen_3_title: Itâ€™s different from the other two cards we talked about, because you donâ€™t need money when you shop.
school_story_9.3_screen_3_button_2_title: So you can just go crazy?
school_story_9.3_screen_4_title: When you shop with the credit card, no money is withdrawn anywhere. But all the things you buy are registered.
school_story_9.3_screen_4_subtitle: At the end of the month you get an invoice, or a bill as it is also called. Then you pay for everything in one go.
school_story_9.3_screen_4_button_1_title: But where does the money come from?
school_story_9.3_screen_5_title: Credit cards are what you can call a loan-card. If you buy something with a credit card, you borrow the money from the bank or a company.
school_story_9.3_screen_6_title: We loosely talked about it already on the planet about spending.
school_story_9.3_screen_6_subtitle: You usually have one month to pay back the money without anything happening. If you do not pay back within that time, the bank or company that issued the credit card charges an interest rate.
school_story_9.3_screen_6_button_2_title: Yes, but interest can be earned or paid!
school_story_9.3_screen_8_title: Interest in this case, is the cost you pay for lending the money from the bank. As I mentioned before, getting a loan is a service that you pay for.
school_story_9.3_screen_9_title: And if you shop for borrowed money, you must repay the debt <bold>and</bold> the extra interest.
school_story_9.3_screen_10_title: You buy a jacket for 600 pb and you pay with a credit card. You cannot afford to pay the invoice on time, so you will have to pay interest..
school_story_9.3_screen_10_subtitle: The interest rate is 10%, which in this case means you pay 60 pb in interest. How much do you owe the bank in total?
school_story_9.3_screen_11_subtitle: It is the debt of 600 pb, + interest of 60 pb. In this way you have paid 660 pb for the jacket instead of 600 pb
school_story_9.3_screen_12_title: Credit cards work well if you are very careful and always pay on time, and never buy more than you can afford to pay back.
school_story_9.3_screen_12_subtitle: There we go, now you know some things about credit cards as well. Even if you canâ€™t use one just yet.
school_story_9.4_screen_1_title: You did well in the challenge!
school_story_9.4_screen_1_subtitle: Now that you know how the cards work, I want to talk about other methods of paying that we mentioned in the beginning of this planet.
school_story_9.4_screen_2_title: Yes exactly! I saved them until now. Because even though they seem new and different, they are based on the classic ways of paying.
school_story_9.4_screen_2_subtitle: When you pay with the Apple Wallet or a smartwatch, or any other app, you most often â€œtapâ€ the phone or watch to the payment machine.
school_story_9.4_screen_3_title: But for this to work, you must first have a card, and that card needs to be connected to the app or the watch!
school_story_9.4_screen_3_subtitle: So actually youâ€™re still paying with your card. But you do it by â€œtappingâ€ your phone or card..
school_story_9.4_screen_4_title: Yes, it is actually the card that you pay with. In some countries you can also connect your phone number to your card and pay via special apps.
school_story_9.4_screen_4_subtitle: Usually you set this up with your bank. Then you can use an app to pay with your phone number.
school_story_9.4_screen_5_title: The bank connects your account to your phone number. Once this is done, anyone can transfer money simply by using the phone number.
school_story_9.4_screen_6_title: So, both the phone number and the bank card are connected to a bank account. When you use any of these, money is removed from your account.
school_story_9.4_screen_6_subtitle: This is done when you use your card or when you use an app to transfer money.
school_story_9.4_screen_7_title: Itâ€™s quite safe. All these apps use a security system and you usually have to use a password or a code to pay. Just like with cards!
school_story_9.4_screen_7_subtitle: But of course you have to make sure your password and code are safe, so no one else can use them.
school_story_9.4_screen_7_button_2_title: I think I get it now
school_story_9.4_screen_9_title: As you have noticed by now, there are many words to keep in mind when it comes to personal finances.
school_story_9.4_screen_9_subtitle: Sometimes a word can mean different things. Like interest. It can be both interest you earn when saving, but also interest you have to pay for borrowing money from the bank.
school_story_9.4_screen_9_button_2_title: I think Iâ€™ve got a handle on it
school_story_9.4_screen_10_title: And some words mean the same thing. For example, invoice and bill.
school_story_9.4_screen_10_subtitle: And that's exactly what we're going to talk about now, but I'll just use the word invoice.
school_story_9.4_screen_10_button_2_titl: Invoice and bill are the same thing!
school_story_9.4_screen_11_title: An invoice is actually a kind of letter of debt or contract that you owe money.
school_story_9.4_screen_11_subtitle: You can receive invoices both in the regular mailbox, and in many ways digitally. It is important to know where the different invoices you get end up so you are aware of them.
school_story_9.4_screen_11_button_1_titl: There is a lot to keep track of
school_story_9.4_screen_12_title: There sure is, isnâ€™t there? But you canâ€™t get invoices until you turn 18. Still, I want you to understand some things about them anyway.
school_story_9.4_screen_13_title: Well, they are a way of paying later, which means not paying at the time you actually make the purchase. Like this:
school_story_9.4_screen_13_subtitle: You buy something, later on you get an invoice. You have to pay the invoice no later than the date written on the invoice. .
school_story_9.4_screen_14_title: It is a handy way of paying for things you use all the time. Like electricity! Imagine if you had to pay directly, every time you turn on a lamp or charge your phone.
school_story_9.4_screen_15_title: But you can get invoices for many different reasons. Like products, services or for credit cards, like we talked about.
school_story_9.4_screen_16_title: Now youâ€™ve learned a lot about different ways of paying. It would be possible to spend money without knowing all thisâ€¦
school_story_9.4_screen_16_subtitle: ... but to have Superskills you have to know different methods, and choose the one that works best!
school_story_10.1_screen_1_title: On the planet about saving, we went through the basics of saving and why it is important.
school_story_10.1_screen_1_subtitle: And as you know, there are many ways to save!
school_story_10.1_screen_2_title: We are going to talk more about saving money at the bank.
school_story_10.1_screen_2_subtitle: There are many different options, so it's good to know about them for when it's time to make a choice.
school_story_10.1_screen_3_title: Do you remember the interest you can get paid by the bank? This interest is often called â€savings interestâ€ specifically, and is typically paid out once a year.
school_story_10.1_screen_3_subtitle: The interest is generally quite low, often between 0 and 0.5%.
school_story_10.1_screen_4_title: I know, it doesnâ€™t sound like much. But the more you save and the longer you do it, the more interest you get paid!
school_story_10.1_screen_4_subtitle: On this planet I'll tell you about how to earn even more from saving, but first I want to tell you something else.
school_story_10.1_screen_5_title: I promised I would teach you more about investing. Investing is a way to use your money. It's often called a kind of saving
school_story_10.1_screen_5_button_1_titl: Wait, both saving and using at the same time?
school_story_10.1_screen_6_title: Yes, it's actually both! Have you ever heard anyone say â€œsave in stocksâ€?
school_story_10.1_screen_7_title: Both the word â€savingâ€ and â€investingâ€ are used because you put away, invest, your money in stocks. But you are also using your money because you are buying the stocks.
school_story_10.1_screen_9_title: To invest, means that you pay money to buy something with the hope that the value will increase, or to â€get a returnâ€ as its called.
school_story_10.1_screen_9_subtitle: There is a risk and the more return you can get, the higher the risk. We will talk more about risk later.
school_story_10.1_screen_10_title: Okay, letâ€™s do more! Have you thought about what a company is?
school_story_10.1_screen_11_title: A company is a business that provides products or services for sale.
school_story_10.1_screen_11_subtitle: You've probably heard of Disney, IKEA, Coca-Cola or Spotify? Those are all companies.
school_story_10.1_screen_12_title: And you already know what products and services are.
school_story_10.1_screen_12_subtitle: There are a lot of companies in Sweden, about one million!
school_story_10.1_screen_13_title: You can think of companies as fruit trees in a garden. There are different kinds of fruit trees, just as there are different kinds of companies.
school_story_10.1_screen_14_title: A newly started company is like a freshly planted tree. And a freshly planted tree is more sensitive than a full-grown tree. It needs a lot of water and nutrition.
school_story_10.1_screen_14_subtitle: The same is true of newly started companies. They need nutrition and water in the form of money and skilled employees to survive.
school_story_10.1_screen_14_button_1_tit: Where are you going with this Piggy?
school_story_10.1_screen_15_title: Well, if a company gets nutrition, water and a storm doesn't ruin it, it will grow and get stronger. When a company has grown big enough, it can start selling parts of itself to you.
school_story_10.1_screen_16_title: Stocks are a part of the company you can buy. It's like buying a branch of the fruit tree.
school_story_10.1_screen_16_subtitle: Practice this and we will continue later.
school_story_10.2_screen_1_title: So, stocks are parts of a company you can buy. If the company goes well and grows, so will the value of the stocks.
school_story_10.2_screen_1_subtitle: That's why it's an investment. You buy stocks in a company for a certain price with the hope that the company will grow so you can sell the stocks for a higher price than you paid!
school_story_10.2_screen_1_button_3_titl: I want to learn about risk first
school_story_10.2_screen_2_title: When you own stocks, you also have the right to receive a part of what the company has earned during the year. This is called a dividend.
school_story_10.2_screen_2_subtitle: But you have to keep in mind that if things go badly for the company, then the stocks will decrease in value. Then you will lose money when you sell your stocks.
school_story_10.2_screen_2_button_1_titl: No! I want to earn money!
school_story_10.2_screen_2_button_4_titl: You have to keep your fingers crossed
school_story_10.2_screen_3_title: Let's go back to our example with trees. If you buy a branch of a tree that is newly planted and sell it when it is a full grown tree, you will be able to sell it for more money than you paid.
school_story_10.2_screen_3_subtitle: And, the return that I spoke of, is like the fruit on the tree! You can get more or less fruit on a tree, depending on how the weather is that year.
school_story_10.2_screen_3_button_1_titl: I am starting to get it
school_story_10.2_screen_4_title: If you want to buy stocks, it's good to know a lot about the company.
school_story_10.2_screen_4_subtitle: You don't know how itâ€™s gonna go for neither companies nor trees in the future, so you guess and take a risk.
school_story_10.2_screen_5_title: The more you know about a company, the less guessing you have to do because you have more information.
school_story_10.2_screen_7_subtitle: You find out that a tree (a company) is sensitive to getting drenched in too much water. You also know it is going to rain very much this year. What should you do?
school_story_10.2_screen_8_title: You should not invest in that tree! Because you know that the risk for losing money is high.
school_story_10.2_screen_9_subtitle: You find out that a tree (a company) grows faster and better when it's windy. This year is supposed to be very windy. What should you do?
school_story_10.2_screen_10_title: You should invest in the tree! If you know that your information is correct, the risk of losing money is low.
school_story_10.2_screen_11_title: Investing in a company is like buying a newly planted tree for a small price. Hopefully it grows bigger and starts to bear fruit. Then you can sell when it's a big tree!
school_story_10.2_screen_11_subtitle: You get money from the fruit every year, depending on the weather, and make money selling it! But there is a risk that it will wither or die and then you will lose the money you invested.
school_story_10.2_screen_11_button_2_tit: You should buy the right tree!
school_story_10.2_screen_12_subtitle: I used the word risk, do you know what risk is?
school_story_10.2_screen_13_title: Risk is quite a complicated term that you need to understand in order to save and invest in stocks. That is, if you want to be able to earn money.
school_story_10.2_screen_13_subtitle: So I will explain risk in another destination!
school_story_10.2_screen_13_button_2_tit: I am going to eat fruits first
school_story_10.3_screen_1_title: Finally! Itâ€˜s time to talk about risk! Do you know what that is?
school_story_10.3_screen_2_title: All those options are about risky stuff. But what about just the word risk? It's actually a word that even adults can have a hard time defining.
school_story_10.3_screen_2_subtitle: But the best description is probably that it is the probability that something undesirable or negative happens.
school_story_10.3_screen_3_title: Often the words risk and chance are seen as opposites, so chance is when you talk about positive things and risk is when you talk about negative things.
school_story_10.3_screen_4_subtitle: Imagine you are lending money to someone. Have you ever done that?
school_story_10.3_screen_6_title: If you have done so, you will of course expect to get your money back when you agreed to.
school_story_10.3_screen_7_title: But there is a risk that you will not get your money back. How big that risk is depends on who you lend to.
school_story_10.3_screen_7_subtitle: The more you know about the person, the easier it is to decide if you want to lend money or not.
school_story_10.3_screen_8_title: If it is someone you trust and who has money, the risk is low. Then it feels okay to lend money.
school_story_10.3_screen_8_subtitle: But if it is someone you donâ€™t know and who doesnâ€™t have money, the risk is high that you will not get your money back.
school_story_10.3_screen_9_title: Okay, is the risk high or low that you will get your money back if you lend it to:
school_story_10.3_screen_9_subtitle: Alien. You know Alien has money at home. And when you lent money to Alien last time, you got it back the next day.
school_story_10.3_screen_10_title: The correct answer was: Low! Is the risk  high or low that you will get your money back if you lend it to:
school_story_10.3_screen_10_subtitle: Toasty, who just bought something expensive for all his money. And Toasty has not returned the money it borrowed from two of your friends last month.
school_story_10.4_screen_1_title: Okay, now we continue about risk and saving in stocks!
school_story_10.4_screen_2_title: When it comes to saving and investing, risk is important to take into account. In a savings account with the deposit warranty, there is a very low risk...
school_story_10.4_screen_3_title: ...but it also has low growth. You make very little money from the interest rate as you remember.
school_story_10.4_screen_3_subtitle: Risk is what allows you to grow your money more. But it is also the risk that makes you lose your money.
school_story_10.4_screen_4_title: We're going back to our garden of fruit trees again.
school_story_10.4_screen_4_subtitle: We say you want to grow bananas in Sweden. If you can do it, you will be greatly rewarded because no one else has succeeded in doing so. Now it is popular to buy food grown locally, so you get a huge return!
school_story_10.4_screen_5_title: But this is almost impossible because we do not have the right climate for banana trees. There is a high risk that things will go badly and you will lose the money you spent on the plants.
school_story_10.4_screen_5_button_1_titl: Shoot, I just started looking for banana seeds
school_story_10.4_screen_7_title: There is also a risk that something unpredictable will happen. If there is a storm, all your fruit trees may die.
school_story_10.4_screen_7_button_2_titl: Whatever, itâ€™s tiresome to water them anyways
school_story_10.4_screen_8_title: And both when you invest in companies, and if you are going to grow fruit trees, you can spread the risk.
school_story_10.4_screen_8_subtitle: For example, by not only buying a lot of one kind, but several different ones instead. So instead of betting all your money on one horse, you spread it around.
school_story_10.4_screen_8_button_1_titl: Ah, like a bag of mixed candy!
school_story_10.4_screen_9_title: Letâ€™s say you only have apple trees in your garden. One year thereâ€™s a disease, apple plague. Then all your trees will die and you will have lost all the money you put in.
school_story_10.4_screen_9_subtitle: But if you have banana trees, plum trees and apple trees instead, then you have all the banana trees and plum trees left after the apple plague.
school_story_10.4_screen_9_button_2_titl: Noted, spreading the risk is smart
school_story_10.4_screen_10_title: If you want to buy stocks in many different companies, you can buy funds.
school_story_10.4_screen_10_subtitle: A fund is a bundle of many different stocks. It often contains between 20 and 100 different companies!
school_story_10.4_screen_11_title: A fund is like owning an entire garden of fruit trees taken care of by a gardener.
school_story_10.4_screen_11_subtitle: In fund language, the person who takes care of the fund is called the fund manager. And managing the fund and doing the work for you is a service, and services cost money.
school_story_10.4_screen_11_button_3_tit: Yes, you have to pay for services
school_story_10.4_screen_12_title: The fee you pay is called the annual fee and is usually quite low. But you have to be careful, some fees are much higher. You have to learn and keep an eye on that too!
school_story_10.4_screen_12_subtitle: The fee is taken from the money you earn, the dividend, , so it's good if the fee is low.
school_story_10.4_screen_12_button_1_tit: This is a lot of information!
school_story_10.4_screen_12_button_2_tit: You have to keep an eye on everything!
school_story_10.4_screen_12_button_3_tit: I always try to keep track
school_story_10.4_screen_12_button_4_tit: Good that you let me know!
school_story_10.4_screen_13_title: Okay, at least now you know a little bit about how investing in companies works, and what the risk is.
school_story_10.4_screen_13_subtitle: I will go and check on my garden, I havenâ€˜t watered my blueberries!
school_story_11.1_screen_1_title: What actually happens if you do not pay what you owe? This is different depending on  <bold>why</bold> you owe money!
school_story_11.1_screen_1_subtitle: Because if you're in a store and run out with a product without paying, thatâ€™s shoplifting, even theft.
school_story_11.1_screen_2_title: That's right! And if you have received a product or service and you have promised to pay, then you have entered into an agreement. And then you become liable for payment.
school_story_11.1_screen_2_subtitle: Not paying when you have to, also has consequences. Even if it's not the same as stealing in a store, you will not get away.
school_story_11.1_screen_2_button_1_titl: But I'm a fast runner! Only joking!
school_story_11.1_screen_3_title: You already know about different ways to pay, if you did planet 6. But itâ€™s all just different ways for the same:
school_story_11.1_screen_3_subtitle: a way to pay for what you want to buy. Do you remember any of the ways?
school_story_11.1_screen_4_title: Often, nowadays, you can even choose how you want to pay. Like when I bought a glass figurine of myself online last week.
school_story_11.1_screen_4_subtitle: Then I could choose between paying directly, by card or cash for example, or paying later.
school_story_11.1_screen_5_title: If you choose to pay later, you will receive an invoice, or bill as it is also called. The invoice contains all the information you need, especially the date when it must be paid at the latest.
school_story_11.1_screen_5_subtitle: If you don't do that, you will owe money. If you owe any money, it is called that you have a debt.
school_story_11.1_screen_6_subtitle: Have you thought about what happens if you do not pay the bill?
school_story_11.1_screen_7_title: Let's say you buy a game that costs 200 pb and you choose to pay by invoice.
school_story_11.1_screen_9_title: At this store you have 30 days to pay the invoice. But as you know, it can vary depending on which company you shop at.
school_story_11.1_screen_9_subtitle: What do you think they will do if you do not pay within 30 days?
school_story_11.1_screen_9_button_1_titl: They might... no, I do not know
school_story_11.1_screen_9_button_4_titl: They call and yell at me
school_story_11.1_screen_10_title: Yes, then they will send you a reminder.
school_story_11.1_screen_10_button_1_tit: Ok, that doesn't sound too bad...
school_story_11.1_screen_11_title: Well, that might not be so awful. But.
school_story_11.1_screen_11_subtitle: Because it means extra work for the company to send out the reminder, they charge for it. A reminder fee.
school_story_11.1_screen_12_title: Yes, that's how it is. Because you were liable for payment. Reminder fees are usually around 60 pb.
school_story_11.1_screen_12_subtitle: The game you bought cost 200 pb. How big is your debt now?
school_story_11.1_screen_13_subtitle: What do you think will happen if you do not pay your debt now?
school_story_11.1_screen_14_title: Then they will send another reminder.
school_story_11.1_screen_14_subtitle: Sometimes that also costs a fee, but usually not.
school_story_11.2_screen_1_title: We will continue where we left off; the company had sent two reminders and you still haven't paid.
school_story_11.2_screen_1_subtitle: The company you owe, can now turn to another company to help them to make you pay your debt.
school_story_11.2_screen_2_title: They are now sending your debt to a debt collection agency.
school_story_11.2_screen_2_subtitle: Debt collectors help companies send debt reminders.
school_story_11.2_screen_3_title: And now your debt will get even higher! A reminder fee from a debt collection agency costs 180 pb.
school_story_11.2_screen_3_subtitle: Your debt was already up to 260 pb. 200 pb for the game and 60 pb in reminder fee from the company. How much will it be now?
school_story_11.2_screen_4_subtitle: So your debt has increased from 200 pb to 440 pb. Just because you didn't pay.
school_story_11.2_screen_5_title: That's not good at all, if you don't pay it becomes expensive! And if you still do not pay, the debt will pass on to the Enforcement Agency.
school_story_11.2_screen_5_subtitle: It can have consequences in the long run, but we'll talk about that after the challenge, my carrots are boiling over!
school_story_11.2_screen_5_button_4_titl: Thought you were a pig, not a rabbit...
school_story_11.2_screen_6_title: Let's go on to what happens if you do not pay your bills.
school_story_11.2_screen_6_subtitle: Last story we ended up being sent to the debt collection agency. Remember?
school_story_11.2_screen_7_title: In our example, the company you owed money to sent two reminders, and then contacted a debt collection agency.
school_story_11.2_screen_7_subtitle: Your debt increased from 200 pb for the purchase, to 440 pb when reminder fees and debt collection claims were added to it.
school_story_11.2_screen_9_title: But what do you think will happen if you still don't pay the debt?
school_story_11.2_screen_10_title: There may be even more fees from the debt collection agency, or they may choose to engage the Enforcement Authority.
school_story_11.2_screen_11_title: The Enforcement Authority is a government agency which has two tasks. The first is to help those who need help collecting a debt that someone doesn't pay.
school_story_11.2_screen_11_subtitle: The other is to provide support and advice to those who need to pay a debt they have.
school_story_11.2_screen_12_title: When the Enforcement Authority has taken over a case, you get a payment demand. And this you also have to pay for.
school_story_11.2_screen_12_subtitle: If it has gone this far, you now owe the company 440 pb and the Enforcement Authority 680 pb. How much will it be?
school_story_11.2_screen_13_title: The answer is 1 120 pb. If you pay everything now, both the debt to the company and what you owe the Enforcement Authority, then nothing more happens.
school_story_11.2_screen_13_subtitle: But keep in mind that you owed almost 6 times what the purchase of 200 pb cost, because you did not pay earlier.
school_story_11.2_screen_14_title: What if you received one of these demands or debt collection claims without owing money? Then you have to tell them it's not correct. That is called to dispute.
school_story_11.2_screen_14_subtitle: It is important to know that you can not just ignore the letters from debt collectors and the Enforcement Authority, instead you must dispute it in time.
school_story_11.3_screen_1_title: We continue from when the Enforcement Authority has made a decision and decided that you have to pay. If you still donâ€™t pay...
school_story_11.3_screen_1_subtitle: ...then there's another step. Something that can have larger consequences for you for a long time.
school_story_11.3_screen_2_title: The Enforcement Authority has the information that you have a debt with them and that it is not being paid.
school_story_11.3_screen_2_subtitle: That information is shared with something called a credit reference agency. A credit reference agency collects  information about everyone and keeps track of if you can handle your payments or not.
school_story_11.3_screen_3_title: When the credit reference agency has the information about an unpaid debt with the Enforcement Authority, you get a payment remark.
school_story_11.3_screen_3_subtitle: It is not good at all to get a payment remark. It stays for 3 years and makes it much harder for you to pay by invoice, get a cell phone plan or rent an apartment.
school_story_11.3_screen_4_title: It's serious not to pay your debts. Like I said, it can cost you a lot and have long-term consequences.
school_story_11.3_screen_4_subtitle: If you have larger debts, the Enforcement Authority also has the right to come to your home and sell your things to pay your debts.
school_story_11.3_screen_4_button_1_titl: Huh, how can they do that?
school_story_11.3_screen_4_button_2_titl: Yes, if you didnâ€™t pay itâ€™s not yours.
school_story_11.3_screen_5_title: Yes, it is so, if you have not paid, you do not own it. But let's summarise: If you do not pay on time, a debt of 200 pb can increase to 1120 pb.
school_story_11.3_screen_5_subtitle: And it can have consequences for several years, like a payment remark. So pay on time, it pays off!
school_story_11.3_screen_5_button_1_titl: Yes, just sounds stupid not to
school_story_11.3_screen_5_button_3_titl: I'll only shop if I can afford it!
school_story_11.3_screen_5_button_4_titl: I do not want a payment remark
school_story_11.3_screen_7_title: Now we will change the subject a bit. I want to ask you something!
school_story_11.3_screen_7_subtitle: Is there anything expensive that you would like to buy but can not afford?
school_story_11.3_screen_8_title: Yes I also have dreams about expensive stuff. I would like to buy a small moon orbiting the planet 578, to build a holiday house on.
school_story_11.3_screen_8_subtitle: But it's a big expense, and I'll save for some time before I can afford it.
school_story_11.3_screen_8_button_2_titl: A moon? I want one too!
school_story_11.3_screen_8_button_4_titl: Nothing is better than the archipelago!
school_story_11.3_screen_9_title: It is true that it is better to save up than to borrow, but sometimes you have to go for a different solution.
school_story_11.3_screen_9_subtitle: And loans for housing, for example, a lot of people take at some point in their lives, because there are very few who are able to save enough to buy a house.
school_story_11.3_screen_10_title: If, for example, the refrigerator breaks and you do not have a buffer saved, you canâ€™t afford it. But without a refrigerator life gets a little less comfortable.
school_story_11.3_screen_10_subtitle: When you donâ€™t have the money to pay for the purchase directly, there are many companies that allow you to buy it in instalments.
school_story_11.3_screen_10_button_1_tit: I think I know what that is
school_story_11.3_screen_11_title: Buying in instalments means that you donâ€™t pay the full amount at the same time. Instead, the company divides it into several smaller payments over a certain period of time.
school_story_11.3_screen_11_subtitle: It is often easier to pay a small amount each month when you receive a salary, because you need to keep money from the salary for regular costs as well.
school_story_11.3_screen_12_title: Let's try to count. If you wanted to buy something for 10 000 pb in instalments, and had 10 months to pay,
school_story_11.3_screen_12_subtitle: how much do you have to pay per month?
school_story_11.3_screen_13_title: If the company doesnâ€™t charge any fees, the correct answer would be: 1 000 pb/month.
school_story_11.3_screen_13_subtitle: But when paying in instalments, interest and other fees are often added, which makes it more expensive than paying directly. So you should try to have that savings buffer...
school_story_11.3_screen_13_button_2_tit: Savings buffer is a good idea
school_story_11.3_screen_14_title: In any case, in order to be allowed to buy in instalments, or take a loan from the bank, the company would like to see if they think you will pay what you owe.
school_story_11.3_screen_14_subtitle: Both loans and instalments are paid after you have received what you bought, in retrospect, and if they think you will not pay, companies or banks donâ€™t want to agree to it.
school_story_11.4_screen_1_title: It can be tricky to know if someone will pay or not, but there is a way for companies and banks to find out information about your previous payments.
school_story_11.4_screen_2_title: They can ask for a credit reference on you via a credit reference agency. There are about 10 credit reference agencies in Sweden, one of them is UC.
school_story_11.4_screen_3_title: The credit report contains information about your finances. Itâ€™s like a personal finance history.
school_story_11.4_screen_3_subtitle: For example, it says how much you earn if you have a job. If you already have a loan, they are listed here and this is also where payment remarks come in.
school_story_11.4_screen_4_title: Yes, this is where the payment remarks end up.On the credit references of companies like UC, who deal with this.
school_story_11.4_screen_4_button_1_titl: But what is a payment remark?
school_story_11.4_screen_6_title: If you have had debts you have not paid, it is important information for other companies to know. This is why a payment remark can affect whether you get a bank loan, for example.
school_story_11.4_screen_7_title: In order for companies to easily understand whether you will be able to pay or not, a number is calculated for your finances.
school_story_11.4_screen_7_subtitle: The number is between 0 and 100, because it is a percentage.
school_story_11.4_screen_7_button_2_titl: A number is easy to understand!
school_story_11.4_screen_8_title: The estimated percentage of your finances is called the credit risk score.
school_story_11.4_screen_8_subtitle: The credit risk score describes how great the risk is that you will not pay a debt and receive a payment remark within 1 year.
school_story_11.4_screen_9_title: If you have a low credit risk score, a low figure, it means that you handle your payments well. So companies and banks donâ€™t have to be worried that you will not pay them.
school_story_11.4_screen_9_subtitle: But, if you have a high figure in the credit risk score, they will not trust you to pay what you owe.
school_story_11.4_screen_9_button_3_titl: I understand, they donâ€™t want to risk it
school_story_11.4_screen_10_title: A high number can mean that you had a lot of loans or payment remarks in the past. But it could also be that your income is too low.
school_story_11.4_screen_10_subtitle: That is, either you donâ€™t have job or the job you have gives a low salary, and therefore probably can not afford to pay off the loan or debt.
school_story_11.4_screen_11_title: The important thing is that a credit reference helps companies decide if thereâ€™s a high or a low risk of not being paid for their service or product.
school_story_11.4_screen_11_subtitle: This means that people are not allowed to borrow more than they can afford, which is great because then they donâ€™t end up in major debts and problems!

school_general_tutorial_text_1: Welcome to Superskills Adventure! This is where I teach you real money skills!
school_general_tutorial_text_2: There are many planets here. You will travel between them, and on each planet I will teach you about one financial topic.
school_general_tutorial_text_3: Each planet has destinations, that you will go through with my help. This is how you get knowledge and collect Financial Superskills!
school_general_tutorial_text_4: And hey - whenever you need help: just click on me and Iâ€™ll explain. Are you ready?
school_start_earn_xp: Start collecting XP in the Superskills Adventure!
school_earn_more_xp: Collect more XP in the Superskills Adventure!
school_no_more_xp_to_earn: No more XP to collect in the Superskills Adventure!
school_click_to_get_started: Click here to get started again and again! yaaay
school_beat_your_old_scores: Try to beat your old scores
school_shop_intro_title: Welcome to the Gimi store! Itâ€™s time to shop.
school_shop_intro_subtitle: Here in Superskills Adventure we use a currency called Piggybucks (PB). Currency is another word for money.
school_chapter_disabled_subtitle: Good things come to those who wait. Redo the other planets while waiting!
school_lesson_disabled_title: This is locked! Come back when you have finished the previous destination.
school_lesson_disabled_subtitle: Youâ€™re doing so good, keep up with that!
school_chapter_locked_title: You can't go to this planet yet!
school_chapter_locked_subtitle: You need to help Alien collect enough fuel in the Rocket Launch on a previous planet first
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_1_title:
Good job on the destinations!
The rocket is spick and span and ready for launch.
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_1_subtitle: But for us to be able to go to the next planet, we have to get fuel!
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_2_title: Here at the station we can get it by answering correctly to some questions about finance.
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_2_subtitle: You learned some new thing on this planet, can you try it for us?
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_3_title: You will get ten questions. The meter will fill up with one liter per correct answer.
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_3_subtitle: For the rocket to launch we need at least 5 liters of fuel!
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_4_title: If we can't launch you can go back to Piggy at the destinations and after, we try again. And remember, there is a time limit for answering the questions!
school_rocket_tutorial_screen_4_subtitle: I'm ready, Are you? Let's see if we can launch and discover the next planet!
school_story_snippet_1_screen_1_title: You are new here right?Â I'm Alien. I always wanted to travel the galaxy. I have a rocket but never been able to get any fuel...
school_story_snippet_1_screen_2_title: ...But to get fuel here, you have to have mad financial Superskills and I know nothing about money.
school_story_snippet_1_screen_3_title: I just have to stay here and watch my rocket get dusty. But hey! Maybe we can help each other!
school_story_snippet_1_screen_4_title: If you learn from Piggy, I'll prepare the rocket for travel. Then we can go get fuel together! Deal?
school_feedback_double_check_answer: Double check your answer next time.
